name: Accelerated First-Year Korean
description: Designed for students who understand or speak but do not read or write Korean. Not open to native speakers of Korean.  Six class hours a week for one semester. Korean 604 and 506 may not both be counted; Korean 604 and 507 may not both be counted. Prerequisite: Results on the placement examination in Korean that indicate that the student is ineligible to receive credit for Korean 507. If the student is eligible to receive credit by examination for Korean 506, this credit must not appear on the student's record.

name: First-Year Korean I
description: Not open to native speakers of Korean.  Five class hours a week for one semester. Korean 604 and 506 may not both be counted.

name: First-Year Korean II
description: Not open to native speakers of Korean. Continuation of Korean 506. Five class hours a week for one semester. Korean 604 and 507 may not both be counted. Prerequisite: Korean 506 with a grade of at least C.

name: Accelerated Second-Year Korean
description: Not open to native speakers of Korean. Continuation of Korean 604. Six class hours a week for one semester. Korean 612 and 412K may not both be counted; Korean 612 and 412L may not both be counted. Prerequisite: Korean 604 with a grade of at least C.

name: Second-Year Korean I
description: Not open to native speakers of Korean.  Four lecture hours a week for one semester. Korean 612 and 412K may not both be counted. Prerequisite: Korean 507 with a grade of at least C.

name: Second-Year Korean II
description: Not open to native speakers of Korean.  Four lecture hours a week for one semester. Korean 612 and 412L may not both be counted. Prerequisite: Korean 412K with a grade of at least C.

name: Third-Year Korean I
description: Three lecture hours a week for one semester. Prerequisite: Korean 612 or 412L with a grade of at least C.

name: Third-Year Korean II
description: Three lecture hours a week for one semester. Prerequisite: Korean 320K with a grade of at least C.

name: Topics in Advanced Korean
description: Fourth-year Korean readings on special topics. Three lecture hours a week for one semester.  May be repeated for credit when the topics vary. Prerequisite: Korean 320L with a grade of at least C.

name: Conference Course in Korean Language and Literature
description: Supervised individual study of selected problems in Korean language or literature. Conference course.  May be repeated for credit. Prerequisite: Korean 412K and written consent of instructor on form obtained from the undergraduate adviser.
